item.title: Dare to Lead by Brene Brown
item.description: Thoughts I’ve been reading this book for over a month now. It has been truly inspirational. It is one of those books that when you read it and finish, you want to start reading again.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: All things grow with time, except grief
item.description: Reflecting on Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s passing away. RBG - Steadfast Commitment “The arc of the universe is long, but it bends toward justice,” but only “if there is a steadfast commitment to see the task through to completion.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Paradise on Fire
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Chained Non-citizens
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Plan B
item.description: Happened to watch the first 3 episodes of Raised by Wolves1. I was expecting just an episode to get launched in the typical HBO fashion. But getting 3 episodes was a bonus.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Money Effect
item.description: “Money is the root of all evil” took a different meaning in my mind when I read this portion (quote below) from Thinking, Fast and Slow.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Engineering Manager Interviews
item.description: A couple of folks asked me recently my opinion on how to do well in an Engineering Manager interview or what should they do to be more successful.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Migrating to a new theme
item.description: I’ve been thinking of migrating the site to a new theme which had a better font than I had. Also wanted a smaller font to cover lot of text in a smaller area.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Writing Habit
item.description: One of the things that I wanted to do this year was to focus a bit more on writing. I’ve had times when I wrote in bursts, and I always told myself - Yeah, this is great.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Great Expectations by Charles Dickens
item.description: Thoughts As I had mentioned in My Reading Journey, The Great Expectations was one of the first novels I read. I’ve read it so many times over the years, each time taking something away more than before.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Return of the Native by Thomas Hardy
item.description: Thoughts This was the first Thomas Hardy novel that I’d read, probably during my engineering days, and re-reading it brings a lot of memories back. What I realize is that I got the gist of the story but had missed out on a lot of details that Hardy provides.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Leadership - Essential Books
item.description: The following two quotes sum up my ideal of leadership. “The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things. He is the one that gets the people to do the greatest things.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Favorite TV Title Sequence Themes
item.description: Was listening to the awesome title sequence of His Dark Materials again today. It is one of those pieces of music that keep replaying in your mind even after you stop listening to it.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Software Development - Essential Books
item.description: As a person who loves checking off items in ‘to-do’ lists and checklists, I’ve always liked books that have a list of rules/principles. Hence books like Effective Java, 201 Principles are the ones that come to mind when I think of a reading list of books related to Software Development.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: GCP Fundamentals Core Infrastructure
item.description: Thoughts If you’re looking for a sweeping introduction to all the various products under the Google Cloud umbrella, this is definitely the one you need to go through.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Kerala - Russia Connection
item.description: I’d mentioned in another post that I’d do some research on Kerala-Russia connection and get back. This post is in response to that. First some context on what we’ve been doing.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: A Cybersecurity Book List
item.description: Background While writing a note about My Reading Journey, I was reminded that I hadn’t put a section on list of books related to Computer Science in My Reading List.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Zero Trust Networks by Evan Gilman, Doug Barth
item.description: Zero Trust Networks: Building Secure Systems in Untrusted Networks 1st Edition1 Thoughts There is no better time to read this book than now. We’re at a point in history where were have examples of massive data breaches in the past to study from, and also an unprecedented number of businesses going online at a rapid pace, accelerated by shelter-in-place rules enforced to stem the spread of covid-19 virus.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Security Threat Models
item.description: Came across a list of Threat Models in a book on Zero Trust Networks that I just started reading. I had heard of two models in the past - STRIDE and DREAD in the context of security thread classification and ranking for Cyber-physical systems Seifert & Reza (2016).
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: IT Security: Defense against the digital dark arts
item.description: This is an excellent course. It is a great refresher of a lot of cybersecurity concepts that most engineers might have heard of but not know.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Goal: A Process of Ongoing Improvement by Eliyahu M. Goldratt & Jeff Cox
item.description: The book is about Alex, a plant manager who is in the middle of a very difficult situation. Everything seems to be falling apart. Shipments are always late, backlog is growing, factory is bleeding money though every single person is working hard all the time.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Favorite Poems
item.description: In the post about my reading journey, I had mentioned a few poems that were my favorite. Thought I’d just put them all here. One place to come back to read them over and again!
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Like a Psalm - Remembering Dostoyevsky
item.description: While I was walking down the memory lane yesterday, I remembered meeting RR in Chennai and his gift of Crime and Punishment by Fyodor Dostoyevsky. We were best friends in school and I had lost touch with him during engineering.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: My Reading Journey
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: API documentation using Swagger
item.description: Intro Wanted to create an API spec for brainstorming an API that we’re developing. Swagger is probably the most popular API design tool. I had used Apiary (https://apiary.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Catalyst of Change
item.description: Thankfully most of the demonstrations across the U.S. today were peaceful. There was one in San Ramon also where people marched from our local Safeway (Gale Ranch) to City Hall near Bishop Ranch.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Security news today
item.description: The optimism around cybersecurity was dampened today by a news article on WSJ - “Cybersecurity Startups Feel a Pinch on Funding and Sales”. Cybersecurity startups are finding they have to do more with less, as the economic drag of coronavirus precautions makes it difficult to sell their products and enlist new customers while it simultaneously diminishes the size of their funding rounds, investors say.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Position or Knowledge?
item.description: For the past few years, I have read quite a few materials on cybersecurity. In 2017, my professor at SJSU asked me to write a paper on IoT Security and Machine Learning techniques used to protect IoT systems.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Baby steps on Go
item.description: Starting to read up on blockchain. RV mentioned that I might need to learn Go if I need to tryout some HyperLedger frameworks in the future.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Automating the Hugo build and push to GitHub
item.description: Instead of remembering to build and push to GitHub, wanted to automate it. The steps are simple enough to write a script and have a cron job execute it.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Cloud Atlas
item.description: “Yesterday, my life was headed in one direction. Today, it is headed in another.” Was super glad to see Cloud Atlas as one of the books in Bill Gates’s reading list for this summer.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Setting up Hugo Site and Migrating from Jekyll
item.description: A couple of years back, I chanced upon an article where someone was describing how simple it was to set up a static website using Ghost.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Great Mental Models: Volume 1 by Shane Parrish & Rhiannon Beaubien
item.description: I was introduced to The Knowledge Project by AJ last year during one of our 1-1 walks around the campus. He sent me the link to Naval Ravikant’s podcast after the walk, and I listened to it in the bus on the way back home.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: 21 Lessons for the 21st Century by Yuval Noah Harari
item.description: I read this book on the way to and during the Alaska Trip that we took during last winter (2019). Read on the flight from SF to Portland and from there to Anchorage.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Factfulness By Hans Rosling, Anna Rosling Rönnlund, Ola Rosling
item.description: I read this book on the way back from our Alaska Trip during during last winter (2019). The trip itself was magical since it was like going to a different land that I’ve only seen in movies or read in books.
item.dc:creator: Hans Rosling, Anna Rosling Rönnlund, Ola Rosling

item.title: Of Love and Other Demons by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: There are some novels that start slowly, and build up momentum as we progress through the story. And there are others that start with a bang.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: 12 Rules for Life by Jordan Peterson
item.description: Jordan Peterson is one of those people who does not mince words. When you listen to his talks on YouTube, you always come back a little more pumped up and motivated than before.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Snow Crash by Neal Stephenson
item.description: I’d always wanted to read a novel by Neal Stephenson. Back in 2005, NC had mentioned him as a great author who wrote cyber thrillers and I should definitely read.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Payment Systems in the US - Second Edition by Carol Coye Benson , Scott Loftesness
item.description: This is probably the 3rd time I’m reading this book. Got this book when I attended Payments 101 & 201 by Glenbrook in Jan/Feb 2015. It was just a couple of days but was one of the best courses I’ve attended.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: How to Become CEO - The Rules for Rising to the Top of Any Organization by Jeffrey J. Fox
item.description: This is a great book. You can open any page and random and find tidbits that immediately resonate with you. It has so many “I should be doing this, I should have done this, This is super advice” kind of messages.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Blink - The Power of Thinking Without Thinking by Malcom Gladwell
item.description: I like the writing style of Malcom Gladwell. With enchanting short real-life stories and fascinating anecdotes, he takes you right into the book, to a different world where you are a student who is observing and studying the behavior of the people in different parts of the world, effortlessly moving to and fro through different periods of time.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The One Thing by Gary Keller
item.description: The ONE Thing: The Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Result by Gary Keller with Jay Papapsan “If you chase two rabbits, you will not catch either one.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Functional Thinking by Neal Ford
item.description: For someone who has been doing Java programming and reading through lot of OO codebase for over a decade, functional programming is truly a paradigm shift.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Bartimaeus Trilogy by Jonathan Stroud
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Reading List
item.description: Last Updated - 06/06/2020 List of books that I have read, started to read, heard a lot about and want to read. I can at least talk one sentence about these books.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: A Simple MapReduce Job for Iris Dataset
item.description: This blog is an attempt to walk through the process of using hadoop to analyze a dataset that might look similar to an actual dataset that we might encounter.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Writing a simple Mapper and Reducer for Wordcount
item.description: The last blog was about how to run wordcount using the “hadoop-mapreduce-examples.jar” that was automatically available in the VMs. How would it be to really write the Mapper and Reducer for this?
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Running Hadoop WordCount example
item.description: Here is a small example to run Wordcount program on hadoop. I’ve tried to do this using Cloudera VM and also MapR Sandbox. When you start ClouderaVM, it is already loaded with desktop and you can do all the work inside the desktop - open a browser, start a terminal.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Checklist Manifesto by Atul Gawande
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Data De-Duplication Performance With Multi-Threaded FBC Algorithm
item.description: Paper reviewed: Jiang, X., Zhao, J., & Zheng, J. (2014). Enhance Data De – Duplication Performance With Multi – Thread Chunking Algorithm. Santa Clara, CA: Santa Clara University.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Distributional Stability of Chunk Sizes in Data Chunking
item.description: Paper reviewed: Zhanjie, W., & Lang, S. (2013). Research on Distributional Stability of Chunk Sizes in Data Chunking. International Journal of Digital Content Technology and Its Applications, 443-450.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Winnowing: local algorithms for document fingerprinting
item.description: Paper reviewed: Schleimer, S., Wilkerson, D. S., and Aiken, A. 2003. Winnowing: local algorithms for document fingerprinting. In Proceedings of the 2003 ACM SIGMOD International Conference on Management of Data (San Diego, California, USA, June 09 – 12, 2003).
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: A Running Time Improvement for TTTD Algorithm
item.description: Paper reviewed: Moh, T., & Chang, B. (2010). A Running Time Improvement for the Two Thresholds Two Divisors Algorithm. ACM SE ’10 Proceedings of the 48th Annual Southeast Regional Conference.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Let sleeping files lie: Pattern matching in Z-compressed file
item.description: This is a review of the paper on Pattern matching in Z-compressed files. I’d done a project last year to implement LZW compression and chanced upon this paper while I was googling for some information on LZW.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The End of Power by Moses Naim
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg posts a public challenge/goal for himself at the beginning of every year and in 2015 it was to read a new book every two weeks.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Delivering a project and presenting to a multi-level audience
item.description: A project delivery is a culmination of the team’s effort after a series of sprints. After a several sequences of twists and turns or crests and troughs of requirement/direction changes, the team is finally at the juncture where it has produced a product that the client wanted.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Quotes on Learning
item.description: Some quotes on learning - “Disce Quasi Semper Victurus; Vive Quasi Cras Moriturus.” Translated, it means: “Learn As if You Were Going to Live Forever; Live As if You Were Going to Die Tomorrow.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Time Tips
item.description: Count all your time as time to be used and make every attempt to get satisfaction out of every moment. Find something to enjoy in whatever you do.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Handing off a project to a client; what are the risks and challenges?
item.description: The biggest risk and challenge when handing off a project to a client is the fear of meeting the expectation of the client. The lingering question in the mind is “What if what we are presenting is different from what the Client is expecting?
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: What five technical skills are employers seeking? What five soft skills put you on top?
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Social Media and Branding
item.description: We are in an era where social media influences everyone more than parents, friends, peers, etc. A couple of decades back, it was improbably to even think that something virtual could control so many aspects of your lives.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: LinkedIn profiles, how to use them, how to market yourself, how to network
item.description: In this post, we take a segway from discussions around Agile methodology and focus on something that is very important for everyone’s career – to have an online professional profile, something that someone can look at and find out about your career, capabilities and achievements.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Agile tasks lists, what does “done” mean in Agile?
item.description: This is the fourth post in this series of “Introduction to Agile methodology”. The topic of this blog is “Agile task lists, what does “done” mean in Agile?
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Agile Sprint Retrospective
item.description: Agile Sprint Retrospective This is the third post in this series of “Introduction to Agile methodology”. The topic of this blog is “Agile Sprint Retrospective”.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Agile Team and the backlog
item.description: This blog continues on the last week’s blog about introducing Agile to newcomers to the practice. The focus this week is on 2 things – The agile team and the artifacts that they work on, namely “backlogs”.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: What is agile and what are user stories
item.description: Introduction In the earlier days of the software industry, the process of developing software products mirrored engineering practices of the day. Like a bridge construction needed elaborate planning, design and construction, a software product went through a “waterfall” model of requirement definition, design, development, testing and release, with each phase occurring one after another.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Introduction to Data Mining by Pang-Ning Tan, Michael Steinbach, Vipin Kumar
item.description: “Introduction to Data Mining” by Pang-Ning Tan, Michael Steinbach and Vipin Kumar has been recommended to me as a great book to learn about Data Mining.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Spinning Melody and the Gateway
item.description: Reading “The Proof of Heaven” by Dr. Eben Alexander is almost like experiencing the NDE that he went through, to really be at the hospital with him where his loved ones were holding his hand 24/7 while he was in a coma, to be with him while he went through the underground, the gateway and the core back and forth experiencing the bright light and the melodious songs and the angelic being, to be able to hear with the whole being without anyone talking, to be able to see without physical eyes, to not have a concept of time, to feel a divine presence and be overjoyed to the fullest.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Quotes
item.description: “Nothing in the world can take the place of Persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Other World
item.description: “Ankle deep, he waded through the bluebells. His spirit rose and exalted… as he breathed in the sun-drenched air. The glorious day was in its last decline.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: A New Beginning
item.description: More than a year whizzed past without me writing anything here. When you’re working for a company that does more than double the work in less than half the time that the client does it in and if the client happens to be this uber-fast techie company that rolls out 8 million lines of code once every 2 weeks with almost 50K lines of code changing every week, time is a pricey quantity.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Write now, Right now!
item.description: A has given me the ultimatum. “It is too much. You’ve been fooling me for more than a year. Write now. Just 10 minutes. Whatever comes to your mind”
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Astral Blueberries
item.description: I’m lying flat on my back and looking at the open sky. It is clear. There are no stars. Only a single moon. Is the queen of the night sky smiling at me ?
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Rainbow Butterflies
item.description: Thought of finally taking a break to roll up my sleeves, blow the dust off the writing desk and sit and gather the fluttering paper rainbow butterflies and stick them to the book.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: A Poet's Corner
item.description: Re-lived a wonderful moment when I accidentally read one of my old scribblings. There are some places where the moment you go, you feel completely at ease ; you’d stay, transfixed with a longing in your heart to be left there forever!
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Waking Dream
item.description: In my dream I was sleeping. A was shaking my hand. “Achaya..wake up.. wake up.. I can’t find the books.” “What books ? ” “The ones I kept in the box yesterday.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Blue Lenses
item.description: A recent trip to Mount Shasta became more memorable due to me losing my glasses. When the optician asked me if I wanted the sunlight coating, I said yes.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: 7 Habits of Highly Effective People by Steven Covey
item.description: There are many books that when I think back on them, I have this lingering feeling that either due to reading quickly or not taking notes, I didn’t really take in the full essence of the book.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Spice of Life - Movies and Songs
item.description: S called. Before he started speaking, I knew what he’d say. Let’s meet up and study something. Yeah ! it’s been over a month since 2nd semester started and we hadn’t even looked into the books list.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Top 5 Movies and Songs
item.description: Movies English The Matrix Forrest Gump T2 The Saint The Terminal Malayalam Thalavattam Manichittrathazhu Veendum chila veetu kaaryangal Kireedam Sanmanassulavarku samadhanam Kannada
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Is Infinity lit ?
item.description: He was standing near the sun. There was brightness everywhere, almost blinding him. He could see the rays going away – far away to distant lands, giving light, feeding happiness.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The destruction of Sennacherib
item.description: Some days you get up slowly .. sit or sometimes sit n sleep on the bed for sometime .. wait for thoughts to gather, slowly come into terms with the world – as though you need time to gradually transition from one world to completely different one – as though you just came out of water and you’re gasping for breath.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Fermat's Last Theorem - Amir Aczel
item.description: Amir Aczel’s “Fermat’s Last Theorem” begins with this amazing quote by Andrew Wiles. Yes ! he is the one .. the mathematician who solved the most famous unsolvable problem in the history of Mathematics .
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Message in a bottle ?
item.description: Though sleeping, reading and watching movies were the only major things that I did during this weekend, what I really wanted to do was to go to a beach, write something, put it into a bottle and throw it into the sea.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Appearances are deceptive !
item.description: Gosh ! I jus came to know that A’d changed from specs to lenses. When ? Now I got it ! I met him last week.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: A time to celebrate
item.description: St.George’s festival. Theophilus thirumeni (formerly MC Cherian achen) went over St. George’s life – the same story that had been told to me many times as a kid – more so because I had this paranoid fear of snakes.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: A beautiful day
item.description: "...bright copper kettles and warm woolen mittens Brown paper packages tied up with strings, These are a few of my favorite things." ~ 'The Sound of Music' The first thing that I did was to watch the rest of ‘The Sound of Music'
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Francisco d'Anconia's Speech on Money
item.description: Fransisco d’Anconia’s speech from Atlas Shrugged1 when someone says “Money is the root of all evil” “So you think that money is the root of all evil?
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Storyteller's Creed
item.description: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: I am you, You are me
item.description: Chinese new year ! C took us to the most famous sea food restaurant here. ABC seafood center ! We spent a good 20 minutes to find a place to park only to find over 20 people waiting in line.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The Master of The Game
item.description: For three days he has been working on it. Finally he got it. ‘Is that it? That’s all? Aww’ he thought. He could now do it in a mere two hours.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: A Sanguine Tale
item.description: The good soul decides to do something good. He feels happy about the great deed he is about to perform. In his mind he sees obscure faces of people whom he might save.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: All charged up for nothing
item.description: Ever started your day in the office with a rude shock? I mean, shock in the literal sense. I’ve discovered that being a good chap who switches off his monitor before calling it a day (to save power!
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: My Cousin Rachel by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: 6/17 It was Krishna’s wedding. Krishna, my closest pal during childhood; my first best friend (first best friend !! does that sound strange ? well !
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: Makar Chudra by Maxim Gorky
item.description: The story starts with Makar , an aged gypsy conversing with the author. It is dark , the wind is heavy , the campfire is blazing furiously .
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: The King's General by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: The “The Kings General” is unlike any novel that I’ve read. It’s as pacy as a modern day thriller. Reminds me of “Gone with the wind” though.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: about not wanting to buy so many books
item.description: Much as I want to buy as many books as I want , I don’t like being forced into book-buying , to feel that I’ve done something which I could’ve avoided.
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju

item.title: here cometh the time to blog
item.description: everyone seems to be blogging. is that why i want to blog ? nopes . i have this strong tendency to go retro from the direction that the crowd is going .
item.dc:creator: Robinson Raju
